content.title: Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, open 'C:\Users\alpha\AppData\Roaming\youtube\ffmpeg.zip.tmp'
content.body:
View details in Rollbar: [https://app.rollbar.com/a/thomas.iniguez/fix/item/FirstProject/23](https://app.rollbar.com/a/thomas.iniguez/fix/item/FirstProject/23)

```

Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, open 'C:\Users\alpha\AppData\Roaming\youtube\ffmpeg.zip.tmp'

```
content.author: alphaleadership

acceptanceCriteria: The application should successfully complete operations that involve downloading and extracting 'ffmpeg.zip' without encountering 'EPERM' permission errors.
If an 'EPERM' error occurs during file operations, the application should provide a clear and actionable error message to the user, potentially suggesting permission checks or temporary file cleanup.
The application should gracefully handle temporary files (e.g., 'ffmpeg.zip.tmp'), ensuring they are not left locked or inaccessible in case of an operation failure.

details: Clarification on the specific application encountering this error: The error path `C:\Users\alpha\AppData\Roaming\youtube\` suggests an issue with a 'youtube' application, but it's unclear how this relates to the current 'github-gemini-integration' project.
Exact steps to reproduce the error, including what action was being performed when the error occurred.
Details about the operating system version (e.g., Windows 10, Windows 11) and any relevant system configurations (e.g., antivirus software, user account type).
Current file system permissions for the directory `C:\Users\alpha\AppData\Roaming\youtube` and the `ffmpeg.zip.tmp` file (if it exists during the error).
